metadata.Title: CVE-2019-12450 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
file_copy_fallback in gio/gfile.c in GNOME GLib 2.15.0 through 2.61.1 does not properly restrict file permissions while a copy operation is in progress. Instead, default permissions are used.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-12450` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libglib2.0-0 - 2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2
libglib2.0-0-refdbg - 2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2
libglib2.0-bin - 2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2
libglib2.0-data - 2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2
libglib2.0-tests - 2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: glib2.0 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.48.2-0ubuntu4.2').
